newsitem.title: USA: US late cash products bounce higher with NYMEX.
newsitem.headline: US late cash products bounce higher with NYMEX.

text.p: U.S. cash products bounced sharply higher with NYMEX futures by late Thursday, with distillates gaining over 1.25 cents in both centers amid continuing low domestic heating oil stocks.
Although differentials remained stable on heating oil in both centers, absolute prices vaulted 1.50 cents higher with NYMEX.

New York Harbor conventional unleaded M2-grade gasoline gained about 0.60 cent, meanwhile, as differentials weakened about 0.15 cent amid expectations of cargos from Europe and South America, players said.

"Cargoes look like they'll be arriving soon so differentials are coming off a bit," said one East Coast trader. But he added that NYH reformulated A2-grade remained firm with offers at about 0.85 cent over the print.
As predicted earlier by traders, the market seemed to shrug off news of Wednesday's brief fire at Tosco's refinery in Bayway, New Jersey.
Tosco said late Wednesday that the small fire in the refinery's crude unit had been quickly extinguished and did not affect operations.
